quotes.quote: Music is the refuge of souls ulcerated by happiness.
Consistency is the last refuge of the unimaginative.
Uncertainty is the refuge of hope.
Art is man's refuge from adversity.
Obscurity is the refuge of incompetence.
Work is the refuge of people who have nothing better to do.
Luck is always the last refuge of laziness and incompetence.
Writing is a refuge from unhappiness, but has its own sorrows.
Crying is the refuge of plain women, but the ruin of pretty ones.
God is our refuge and our strength, an ever-present help in trouble.
Public opinion is the last refuge of a politician without any opinion.
We take refuge in pride, because we are afraid to tell the truth to ourselves.
Look not for refuge to anyone beside yourself. Heed fast to the truth as a lamp.
One may make their house a palace of sham, or they can make it a home, a refuge.
Books are a refuge, a sort of cloistral refuge, from the vulgarities of the actual world.
Make an island of yourself, make yourself your refuge; there is no other refuge. Make truth your island, make truth your refuge; there is no other refuge.
Nostalgia is the intimate refuge of every man and every woman in a world seemingly gone mad.
All the times these arms were my only refuge from the world. Perhaps not fully appreciated then, but so sweet in my memory, and now gone forever.
Music is a place to take refuge. It's a sanctuary from mediocrity and boredom. It's innocent and it's a place you can lose yourself in thoughts, memories and intricacies
You are your own refuge There is no other You cannot save another You can only save yourself.
The temples are a refuge from life's storms even a never-failing beacon guiding us to safety.
Silence is the universal refuge, the sequel to all dull discourses and all foolish acts, a balm to our every chagrin, as welcome after satiety as after disappointment.
Tolerance is our safest refuge and our fortress against the handicaps that arise from schism, factions, and the difficulties inherent in reaching mutual agreement.
All men have one refuge, a good friend, with whom you can weep and know that he does not smile.
Home is the first refuge from – and last defense against – the disappointments and the terrors of life.
My last refuge, my books: simple pleasures, like finding wild onions by the side of a road, or requited love.
There'll be times when the only refuge is books. Then you'll read as if you meant it, as if your life depended on it.
Science has destroyed even the refuge of the inner life. What was once a sheltering haven has become a place of terror
The only refuge left to us was the poet's ivory tower, which we climbed, ever higher, to isolate ourselves from the mob.
We can find true refuge within our own hearts and minds-right here, right now, in the midst of our moment-to-moment lives.
